  11. This hair mask leaves hair pretty soft, but it's really only because it contains a silicone that coats the hair and makes it appear healthy. Silicones can actually lock out moisture and cause buildup. I really didn't find it impressive and I won't buy it again. It doesn't feel like it really deep conditions at all, and the minimal results go away after a single wash.

  61. After hearing so many positive reviews on this product, and to how all the dirty hippie blogs worship argan oil like the holy grail of luxurious locks, I have to say that I went into this purchase with extremely high hopes and was let down, to say the least. I have seen no difference between this mask and the average off-the-shelf daily conditioner.<br /><br />I have experimented and tinkered with every last drop in the jar in different ways, and feel that I have given this product a more than fair chance to prove itself.<br /><br />The first few tries, I wore it just for the duration of my shower, all through scrubbing, shaving, and so on, before rinsing it. Then, I tried combing it through my entire damp head of hair, wrapping the gooey mess of hair up in a clip atop my head, totally rocking the Jimmy Neutron soft-serve icecream curl for several hours while I did chores before finally rinsing it. I'd hoped that after several days off and weekends in a row that maybe my results would be cumulative, and that parading around in my undergarments with dairy queen dollar menu dessert for hair might be worth it someday, but I was eventually running out of mask and not seeing results. Finally, with the last bit left, I wrapped it up and wore it overnight and rinsed the sludge out of my hair in the morning, even going so far as to take my chances with not quite rinsing it all the way. It didn't even look heavy and greasy like I'd been so worried it would. By this last attempt, I became entirely certain that this product was not in fact doing me any favors at all.<br /><br />But it smells pretty damn nice. So there's that.

Nowhere on amazon does it say it's not a leave in conditioner... I was thinking I could put it in my damp hair and go. At first I was thinking that I was definitely not going to wash my hair, get out of the shower and dry my hair, only to get back in and put the mask in to wash it out. I ended up just squeezing most of the water out of my hair then applying the mask (no towel dry needed). I definitely wouldn't leave this product in the shower though. It's doesn't seem to be too shower proof. I also applied the ultra curl cream after brushing my hair. The results after letting it air dry are amazing! I'm only in my 20's but my hair has seen its share of damage. It felt like straw. This mask brings me back to my pre teens when I just washed my hair, brushed it, and let it dry. Before I used straighteners, curling irons, bleaching treatments, and sea salt sprays. My husband even mentioned the smell and softness if my hair! I think I'll buy this as a gift for my sister, who has the same woes about her hair that I used to have!

  125. To start, I received this as a nice holiday gift since I needed a good conditioner.<br /><br />I had accidentally wrecked my hair recently with body wash (without glasses in the shower I couldn't see the difference) so I needed a conditioner to recover it. Although I'm a man with short red-brown hair, it was visibly dry and frizzy and literally squeaked in the shower when shampooing.<br /><br />***EDIT: My order was a fluke- they have agreed to replace my not properly-filled container with no problem at all. They even offered expedited shipping for my trouble.<br />FANTASTIC Customer Service!***<br /><br />Now- the product itself.<br />The conditioner is thick. Surprisingly thick, even for a conditioner. It has a nice pleasant light scent that didn't bother me, and was a simple off white color.<br /><br />I followed all of the instructions on the container very clearly, leaving it in for about 6 minutes after brushing it through my hair (suggestion was 5-7 minutes leave-in time). When the container said use the product generously, I did have to. Maybe because my hair was pretty destroyed? Not sure. Due to the viscosity I had to use a little more than expected to work it through my hair.<br /><br />After rinsing the product out, I didn't notice much of a difference at first. As usual, I pat-dried my hair with a soft towel, brushed it, and let it dry before checking how it felt.<br /><br />At this point I noticed, wow! Less frizz. Not only that, but my hair was smoother and even a bit darker looking! Totally unexpected.<br /><br />Previous to using this conditioner, as I initially said my hair was pretty dried out and dead. Not from color dying or anything (I'm a man FYI) but from using the wrong product accidentally. My hair is naturally dry anyway (red hair) but either way the conditioner worked quite well.<br /><br />Overall, I would recommend this product, even if the cost is a bit high. Not high in comparison to similar products, even, but high for me as I don't generally invest more than $10 in a container of this size. But this is more of a mask for occasional hair repair than daily-use.more of a mask for occasional hair repair than daily-use.

I had to wash my hair a couple times to remove the oil so that another conditioner could moisturize my hair. I decided to try again -not as directed- using less on top of another conditioner to try to seal in the moisturized hair. The not as directed way worked better but so far In my two uses ,this stuff is not great or even better than a drug store conditioner. The smell I think is unnecessarily strong and gives me a slight headache, also the tub I received says Made in China. Other Argan oil products have not worked well for my hair type either but this was worth a try based on price and reviews. UPDATE 6/13/15 I just found out that reviews can be filtered by verified purchases out of the 1500 or so reviews on this product 140 are actually verified purchases-also among the verified purchases all the critical reviews including mine have been marked not helpful. Some people just do not like the strong smell or the way it works on their hair. Some people love this conditioner too and good for them!- however the results on my hair and several others were left with dryer hair after using this- why was this marked not helpful?? The fact that it is made in a county that has very low quality control such as allowing melamine in baby formula and pet food - is a legit concern for some people. I have reduced my 2 stars down to 1 star because clearly some sleezy marketing tactics are involved. Since good reviews matter to me prior to a purchase-had I known so little of the 1500 reviews were actually verified purchases- I would not have even bought this product in the first place.

  259. I use the mask probably every third day when I'm not going to be blowdrying or straightening my hair, and ALWAYS before I do either of those things. The difference has been remarkable. I have curly red hair and AWFUL water conditions where I live, so throwing in some of that Florida humidity and it was a recipe for disaster. I found this when I was looking for a solution, and ever since I've had this hair mask stocked.<br /><br />It's really, really creamy, without being greasy AT ALL. There's enough in it for me to condition my shoulder length hair about 20 times - you really don't need more than a small scoop. I work it through the ends of my hair and up and leave it in while I'm shaving and scrubbing, and usually by the time I'm ready to rinse it's been well past the recommended 7 minutes, closer to 10. It washes out really easily, and when my hair would normally be tangled even with a little regular conditioner, this one lets me work my fingers through without any problems.<br /><br />But the final product is what makes this worth it for me! I have smooth, pretty curls rather than frizzy, chunky ones, and my hair takes to styling much easier. For the price it is now - significantly discounted - it's worth it. Would I pay $40 for it? No. But for less than $20, this is an amazing mask.

The scent is also incredible - sweet, but not floral, and maybe slightly nutty. This hair mask makes my hair feel incredibly luxurious, and I had to hide this product so that my friend didn't use all of it after I let her try it (she has since purchased her own).<br /><br />Because this is heavier than a conditioner, make sure you rinse out ALL of the product before getting out of the shower so that your hair is not weighed down or greasy. I also found that I get best results when I leave the product in for an hour or more. Most Sunday mornings, I wake up and go for a run, then immediately jump in the shower and wash my hair before applying this product. I shave my legs, wash my body and face, and exfoliate while I let it work. I then get out of the shower with the mask still in my hair. I wrap it in a Turbie Twist and clean the apartment, do some homework, and throw my laundry in before getting back into the shower to wash it out. When I do this and let it sit for 2-3 hours, my hair feels and smells incredible until the next time I wash it.<br /><br />I would wholeheartedly recommend this product to anyone, and I would pay a lot more for it than what they ask for. If you have dry, brittle, or damaged hair, then this is definitely the hair mask for you!

  754. FIRST, A NOTE ABOUT HAIR PRODUCTS CONTAINING ALCOHOL:<br /><br />Fatty alcohols also known as &#34;oily&#34; condition your locks. Here's a tip: say yes, to the alcohols that start with &#34;c&#34; and &#34;s.&#34;<br />Cetearyl alcohol<br />Cetyl alcohol<br />Stearyl alcohol<br /><br />&#34;It's easy to see why &#34;alcohols&#34; are confusing to the average cosmetic label reader. People misinterpret ingredients that have alcohol in their name to be the volatile alcohol that we're most familiar with (ethanol). But, as mentioned above, fancier fatty alcohols, such as cetyl alcohol are not drying; instead, they are actually conditioning to hair and skin.&#34;<br /><br />&#34;Cetearyl alcohol is a white, waxy, solid material in the form of flakes. It is oil soluble, but it is not water-soluble. It is a mixture of fatty alcohols. An alcohol in this sense is not a fermented mixture; it is a chemical compound of a certain molecular structure based on carbon and oxygen. Fatty alcohols were originally prepared from fats and oils by hydrolysis, which produces fatty acids. These were then hydrogenated to form fatty alcohols. More efficient forms of hydrogenation enable fatty alcohols to be formed directly from triglycerides (vegetable oils). Cetearyl alcohol is a wonderful emulsifier. In creams and lotions, it supports the main emulsion system and gives texture to the product. In conditioners, it creates a thickening effect. Cetearyl alcohol in combination with other ingredients in the formula (such as triethanolamine and stearic acid) forms an emulsion. This stops the oil and water from separating. They break down easily when applied to allow the lovely ingredients to benefit the skin/hair. Its emulsifying quality enables effective fresh ingredients to be emulsified. Cetearyl alcohol is used across our entire range of fresh products as an emulsifier. The result is an effective product, which detangles the hair, leaving it with shine and excellent condition.&#34;<br /><br />AND NOW, ONTO MY REVIEW:<br /><br />I decided to try some hair mask products, and in my search, I stumbled across several reviews of Arvazallia and what appeared to be legit before and after pictures. I also noticed this product had an AMAZING introductory price on Amazon. So I figured–why the hell not? I bought the hair conditioning mask and the oil treatment.<br /><br />After purchasing, I received several follow up emails from Arvazallia, who appear to be extremely invested in the satisfaction of their customers. Shorty after that, the product arrived in the mail. Simple, easy to use packaging that wasn’t leaking (plus!) and it smelled HEAVENLY! I’ve tried other argan products in the past (will review them eventually as well) but none have smelled this wonderful. Between the great price and the fabulous scent, I was hoping the product would perform.<br /><br />I have since used the hair mask 4 times (twice a week since it arrived) and have used the oil treatment every day for 2 weeks. If your hair isn’t as treacherous as mine, you could probably use the hair mask once a week or twice a month or once a month or whatever suits your hair care needs. The treatment only takes 5 minutes, however, due to how damaged my hair is, I did my treatments: 30 minutes, overnight, 30 minutes, overnight. I figured . . . why not? Might be overkill if you hair is generally healthy, though. The oil I used daily on the ends of my hair only, which gave a nice immediate improvement in appearance.<br /><br />Things I love about this product: Smells fantastic, easy to use, leaves hair smooth and manageable, perfect packaging means no leaks that waste the product (considering how often this happens with beauty products, it’s worth mentioning). Quality and Value are also worth mentioning, at least at the price I bought this at. The price was unbeatable compared to similar products and a little goes a long way, so I can see this lasting me a long time. The mask may go a little quicker than the oil, only because so little oil is needed for the hair and you get so much of it, but also because I am using the mask twice a week which is probably not necessary for most people. However, I did notice that the first time I used the mask, my hair seemed to soak it all in so much that I needed to use quite a bit, but after that, the moisture in my hair was so improved that I needed much less conditioner on subsequent applications.<br /><br />It’s also worth mentioning that my results are NOT due to suddenly conditioning my hair every day when I wasn’t before. I have been doing a deep treatment conditioning of my hair for months now in the same manner and using hair oils for a couple months now (and I’ve always only washed my hair once a week–before you say eww, this is actually REALLY healthy for your hair.) Those products DID give me results, however, I would say that this product did for my hair in 2 weeks what those products took 4 months to do for me, and I think by this point I was capped out on what those products could do for me. I also had to use a detangler then, but I no longer need one! So . . . yeah, I guess I’m a fan of Arvazallia now!<br /><br />That said, what I find impressive and what you find impressive may differ. My hair problems might also be different from yours. My hair is INSANELY dry and the dead ends have gone to epic extremes, so my hair needed this.<br /><br />All that said, I will now let the before and after results speak for themselves. Check the customer images for more, along with details about how I take my before and after pictures (always on product-free, residue-free, naturally air-dried hair).he oil, only because so little oil is needed for the hair and you get so much of it, but also because I am using the mask twice a week which is probably not necessary for most people. However, I did notice that the first time I used the mask, my hair seemed to soak it all in so much that I needed to use quite a bit, but after that, the moisture in my hair was so improved that I needed much less conditioner on subsequent applications.<br /><br />It’s also worth mentioning that my results are NOT due to suddenly conditioning my hair every day when I wasn’t before. I have been doing a deep treatment conditioning of my hair for months now in the same manner and using hair oils for a couple months now (and I’ve always only washed my hair once a week–before you say eww, this is actually REALLY healthy for your hair.) Those products DID give me results, however, I would say that this product did for my hair in 2 weeks what those products took 4 months to do for me, and I think by this point I was capped out on what those products could do for me. I also had to use a detangler then, but I no longer need one! So . . . yeah, I guess I’m a fan of Arvazallia now!<br /><br />That said, what I find impressive and what you find impressive may differ. My hair is INSANELY dry and the dead ends have gone to epic extremes, so my hair needed this.<br /><br />All that said, I will now let the before and after results speak for themselves.   812. Honestly, I wasn't sure what to expect with this product. I've never bought hair products online before, but the positive reviews convinced me to try it. I have not been disappointed! First off, the scent is quite good. I have tried other hair products that have an overwhelming smell or scent that just won't go away, but the Arvazallia hair mask is not like that. It does have a noticeable scent that is a touch strong when I apply it to my hair in the shower (if you can't do scents, this is definitely not the product for you), but once I have blow-dried my hair (blow dried or blown dry? Anyway, I digress...), the scent that remains is very gentle and barely noticeable. For me, this is a positive thing.<br /><br />Now to the main issue: does it work? -- I will start out by saying I have very straight brown hair of normal thickness that I am currently trying to grow out (not that it really matters, but it's hangs to about the bottom of my shoulder blades right now). I have been having trouble with the middle and ends of my hair getting dry and breaking. A few months' ago, I started using coconut oil as a hair mask once per week. That helped a great deal to make the ends of my hair soft and smooth. My only complaint with the coconut oil was that I have to leave it in my hair 45 minutes before showering. I started looking for a product that didn't take quite as long to &#34;cure,&#34; so to speak. That led me to try the Arvazallia hair mask. I use it 2-3 days per week and it really has been working well for me. It keeps the ends of my hair soft, smooth and moisturized. I am not having nearly as much breakage as I have in the past. I only have to leave it in 5 minutes or so in the shower and it doubles as my conditioner on the days that I apply it. Also, it doesn't leave my hair feeling oily or flat.<br /><br />I really like this hair mask and I expect to purchase it again when my current tub runs out. If you are having trouble keeping the ends of your long hair soft and smooth, then I would recommend you try this. It has definitely helped me.

I have paid far less for more with other products, but I reserved judgment until after my first use. I applied the product liberally to my hair (using about 1/3 of the jar), put a treatment cap and sat under heat for about 10 minutes. Once I rinsed, my hair was not detangled and did not seem particularly moisturized. I am currently wearing my hair curly without heat, so I applied my go-to products for finishing my hair and I was not pleased with the results. I have used conditioners from the drugstore that have performed much better. My hair was dry and the curl pattern was less defined as a result of less moisture. This mask is marketed as an argan oil-based and I felt misled when I reviewed the ingredients list. Argan oil is near the bottom, which means there is only a small amount included in the product. Needless to say, I have not used any more of this product and will not purchase any in the future. There are far better masks on the market that are much more reasonably priced.
  849. This product is amazing. If only my frizzy hair had found this product years ago!!!
  850. Despite years and years of bleaching, I've always considered myself to have a healthy, full head of hair. However, after just a few applications of the Argan Oil Mask, my hair feels amazingly smooth and silky throughout the day and even beyond shampoo to shampoo. Initially, I had expected the need to use the oil after each shampoo but not so. It's lasting conditioner remains with your hair - truly a must have!

  1034. I have a tailbone length hair so keeping my hair as healthy and chemical free as possible is my first priority when it comes to that. I do have to heat style my hair ever so often which damages it and makes my hair and the ends pretty dry and damp like so that’s why I need something that actually helps to nurse my hair back to health. Most shampoos/conditioners/hair masks nowadays include a lot of chemicals that ruin and dry out your hair even more (even though they promise all kinds of miracles) so that’s definitely not a solution for it.<br /><br />What is great about the Hydrating Argan oil hair mask:<br /><br />*Sulfate free. If you didn’t know then sulfates is what makes the shampoo turn into a thick lather in the shower and is also used in other household cleaning products. This is what actually causes frizziness especially in curly hair and damages hair that is color treated and makes it fade off quicker. It might take a little getting used to it because it doesn’t bubble up like typical shampoos do. It is also known that sulfates might cause cancers so that’s something to take into consideration.<br />*Paraben free. It has been found that parabens contain agents called xenoestrogens which are what mimic estrogen in the body and what has been linked to breast cancer and reproductive issues.<br />*Includes Argan and Macadamia oil. Argan oil is one of the best oils to use in your hair, especially because it improves the texture of your hair follicles, also works as a repair treatments and heat protectant. Macadamia oil on the other hand helps to prevent against hair breakage by penetrating the scalp and hair follicles to improve hair strength and elasticity.<br />*got a fresh floral scent to it<br />*is for all hair types<br />*helps to repair the heat damage and fully hydrate your hair<br /><br />I am a big junkie when it comes to hair masks because of my frizzy ends and trying to find as natural products for it as possible. I used to use coconut oil but argan oil is hands down the best for everyone's hair. The way I used it I just applied it on my bottom half of hair (never apply hair masks and conditioners on scalp because it has no effect other than making it oily) and left it in for about 15 minutes before washing it off. Besides smelling really good my ends felt moisturized and definitely weren't as frizzy or dry. I attached a picture to my review so you can see how it made my hair look silky and soft without any frizz.<br /><br />I received the product for free in an exchange of an honest review.oil is hands down the best for everyone's hair. The way I used it I just applied it on my bottom half of hair (never apply hair masks and conditioners on scalp because it has no effect other than making it oily) and left it in for about 15 minutes before washing it off.   1385. Put the exact amount and don't leave it longer than listed in the instructions. I thought if I used more and leave it around 30 or 35 minutes I would get better results. Oh boy! Was I wrong... My hair started falling off in huge amounts!!. For several weeks I would pass my fingers through my hair and large strands of hair would come with my fingers. I was in total disbelief, every time I would pass my fingers, I would get a new bunch of hair in my hands. I only used it once but this lasted for several weeks and I lost lots, lots of hair. I used to put my hair up with a large hair clip and it was hard to close because so much hair I had. Now, I only use a small hair clip, the length of my index finger, to put it up. At the present time, my hair stopped falling off. I am waiting for the hair I lost to grow back and see if I can recuperate what I lost. Needless to say, I fear to use the product again even though it left my hair soft and free of any freezing. I gave it four starts because they should warn people not to exceed the amount and the time. It is a good product and it works, just don't make the mistake I made. Do not use more than what it says in the instructions and do not leave too long!

  1512. I have to say this is the best conditioning product I have ever used.<br /><br />I have thick, naturally wavy hair that has been a nightmare my entire life. It does what it wants, it gets extremely frizzy in both humid and dry conditions and it tangles easily. In the summer it's even worse because I'm in the pool every day and the chlorine really takes it's toll.<br /><br />I've tried so many different conditioners I've lost count. Some work ok, some don't work at all and same made things worse. I've tried other products with Argan oil in them too and, while better than most, they still weren't amazing. I found this product here last year during the summer when my ends were fried crispy from chlorine. I didn't think anything would make that much of a difference but after reading all the reviews I decided to give it a shot. I am so happy I did.<br /><br />I use just a little once or twice a week as a quick conditioner and then when my hair starts really frizzing and look dull and damaged - in the summer from the chlorine and in the winter from the dry air - I slather it on and leave it in for several hours. When I rinse and dry after that it's like I have different hair. No frizz, no crispiness - it's soft, silky and smells great! I also get far fewer tangles than I used to and the ones I do get are much easier to comb out, which is a big plus for me.<br /><br />I've seen a couple of reviews here saying the product left their hair greasy or it was too heavy. I have to guess they are not rinsing it out well enough after using. I could see that happening if you don't rinse properly. But I've been using it for over a year now, I always make sure to rinse it out completely and I have never experienced that problem, even after leaving it in for hours. No greasiness, no heaviness, just soft, silky, awesome feeling hair.<br /><br />If you're like me - and have tried everything and almost given up on finding something that works - give this a shot. I almost guarantee you'll be glad you did. I know I am!be glad you did. I know I am!
